title: Wartorn
description: A narrative-driven game where players control a child separated from their parents during a war, exploring a ruined city to gather supplies and search for clues about their parents' whereabouts.

jobs-section.title: Dialogue System
jobs: Designed and developed a dynamic and flexible Dialogue System enabling writers and designers to create and modify dialogue sequences with ease, ensuring adaptability throughout the development process.
Implemented support for Dialogue Trees to offer players meaningful choices and enhance player immersion.
Collaborated closely with writers and designers to ensure the system exposed essential properties and options for them to create their compelling stories.

jobs-section.title: Dialogue System's UI
jobs: Developed modular UI Components for diverse dialogue scenarios using Unreal Engine's UI framework (widgets, canvas, and text elements).

jobs-section.title: Visual Effects
jobs: Collaborated closely with VFX members to integrate and synchronize weapon and ability effects across the network, ensuring consistency and visual fidelity during gameplay.

gifs-section.caption: Fade in and fade out effect

thoughts: This was my first Unreal Project where I got to learn the basics of Unreal. I got experience using Unreal's blueprint system, as well as their UI system. Although I had a small part in this project, I believe I was able to come up with a very flexible dialogue system that helped out the writers a lot.

title: QuickShot
description: A fast-paced multiplayer FPS where players use a sniper rifle, dash, and grapple hook to outmaneuver opponents and dominate the arena in free-for-all battles.

jobs-section.title: Weapon System
jobs: Developed a shooting system supporting both hit-scan and non-hit-scan modes.
Implemented a mode-swapping feature, enabling seamless transitions between weapon types.
Built a flexible weapon configuration system that allowed designers to adjust parameters like damage multipliers, fire rate, and swap time dynamically.

jobs-section.title: Gameplay System
jobs: Developed a respawn system for managing players spawning within the maps.
Created a data storage system to track and propagate essential player statistics across the network.
Developed a modern lobby system where players could view their characters alongside others in real time.

jobs-section.title: Network
jobs: Engineered systems to synchronize critical data (e.g., health, time, score, abilities, and shooting events) across all clients in the match.
Created serialization methods to support the transmission of non-default data types over Photon’s networking framework.
Developed backend functionality for a lobby system, enabling players to find and join active games or lobbies.
Used Photon’s networking framework to balance the authority of the master client (server) over the other clients in the match.

jobs-section.title: UI
jobs: Collaborated with UI designers to create a flexible system responsive to user input and game data, such as the scoreboard, main menu, health indicators, and final screens.

jobs-section.title: Visual Effects
jobs: Collaborated closely with VFX members to integrate and synchronize weapon and ability effects across the network, ensuring consistency and visual fidelity during gameplay.

gifs-section.caption: Players can create lobbies of their own that others can join
Dash Effect in first and third person view

thoughts: This was the first time I was working on a shooting game where I played a key role on its development. It was also in this project where I got to learn more about how networking in games work and how to tackle problems that come with it like latency and synchronization. I know there are still things left to do for this game, but I'm happy with what my team and I were able to accomplish with the time we were given to finish this project. I hope to be able to come back soon to this project and polish it enough to put up on steam for people to play (some people were asking for it ;) ).

jobs-section.title: Software Engineering
jobs: Developed a detailed UML diagram that outlined the game's systems, providing a clear architectural guide for fellow programmers and ensuring consistent development across all features.

jobs-section.title: Movement System
jobs: Designed and implemented a movement system capable of seamlessly transitioning between modes while preserving player momentum.
Applied linear algebra to calculate movement vectors on angled slopes and curved walls, ensuring smooth and realistic traversal.
Worked closely with designers to offer flexibility in configuring movement mechanics, including transitions and customizable settings tailored to gameplay needs.

jobs-section.title: Health System
jobs: Built a robust health system supporting diverse mechanics, including healing and damage over time, invincibility modes, health regeneration, and handling simple respawning.

jobs-section.title: “AI Director”
jobs: Developed an algorithm for procedurally spawning enemies in designated areas based on designer-defined metrics.
Designed and developed a complex dynamic pacing algorithm to create peaks and valleys of “emotional intensity” for the player.
